page.title: 02Changing Times in Warton
page.content: Warton, or "weard-tun",means "town by the lookout". The older homesteads retain the pattern of a mediaeval borough which only in modern times has regained its size,but not its prestige, from the sackings by the Scots and the Black Death in the 14th century. Over 86% of homes are 20th century, 65% built since World War II. Of around 1000 homes in the electoral ward almost 600 are in the village. Unease at rapid growth in the 1950's has given way to a well-knit community. School and Church have both unified through the young but a large elderly element contribute greatly to a growing number of thriving organisations and groups. A newish Village Society seeks to conserve the heritage and to protect it from alien influences.
